Description: Vase of pale brown marl pottery with a flat base, barrel-shaped body and narrow neck, terminating in an external roll-rim and coated with a thin red slip. Good condition.
Curator's comments: This date for this object is supported by the presence of a cylinder jar of type W.71a in grave H.66. See Ayrton and Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna', pl.XXXIII, 71a. Bibliography: E. R. Ayrton & W. L. S. Loat, 'Pre-dynastic cemetery at El Mahasna' (London, 1911), 20 and pl. XXXIII, 65b. The vase is visible in the view of grave H.66, on pl.vii, 34. Vessel type L65b at el Mahasna is reproduced as type L59G in Petrie’s Corpus of Predynastic Pottery.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 17 Jan 2003. Internal loan, Oriental Antiquities, Addis Gallery.
